newsitem.title: USA: United Dominion Realty sells preferred stock.
newsitem.headline: United Dominion Realty sells preferred stock.

text.p: United Dominion Realty Trust Inc on Friday said it sold six million shares of 8.6 percent Series B cumulative redeemable preferred stock at $25 per share.
The company said the stock has no stated maturity, sinking fund or mandatory redemption, and it is not convertible into any other United Dominion Realty securities.
The preferred stock may be called by the company at par on or after May 29, 2007, it said.
Net proceeds of about $145 million will be used primarily to repay short-term bank debt, it said.
The company said its preferred stock had been rated BBB by Standard & Poor's and Baa2 by Moody's.
